tool.name: MultiScaleDL

param.name: in_raster
param.datatype: Map Server or Raster Data Layer or Image Service or Mosaic Dataset or Raster Dataset or Raster Layer
param.dialogReference: Input raster used to apply the Deep Learning upon. Spec of image has to match the requirements of the used DL model
param.pythonReference: full path to input raster as string

param.name: cell_sizes
param.dialogReference: comma separated list of spatial resolutions to use. Example: '0.5,1,2,5'Units have to match the SRS used.
param.pythonReference: comma separated list of spatial resolutions, provided as string. Use point as decimal separator. Example: "0.5,1,2,5"

param.name: use_avg_cell_size
param.dialogReference: Definition of output cellsize: Use average cell size calculated from list of cell sizes above
param.pythonReference: boolean. Definition of output cellsize: If TRUE, use average cell size calculated from list of cell sizes above

param.name: specified_cell_size
param.dialogReference: Definition of output cellsize: Define custom output cell size as decimal value. It should be one of the above specified cell sizes. The chosen custom value will be used as the base feature that the tool will append missing inferenced features from other cell sizes to.
param.pythonReference: Definition of output cellsize: Define custom output cell size as decimal valueExample 0.2

param.name: dl_workflow
param.expression: General Feature Extraction | Text SAM Feature Extraction
param.dialogReference: Specify workflow category from Dropdown List. Category needs to be suitable for the Deep Learning model chosen below.
param.pythonReference: Specify workflow category from Dropdown List. Category needs to be suitable for the Deep Learning model chosen below. Provide as String. Currently supported: "General Feature Extraction" and "Text SAM Feature Extraction"

param.name: out_gdb
param.pythonReference: Specify output Geodatabase for result storage. Provide as full path as string

param.name: out_fc_name
param.dialogReference: Enter Name for output Feature Class. Will be created in Output Geodatabase specified above
param.pythonReference: Provide Name of Output Feature Class as String. Will be created in Output Geodatabase specified above

param.name: text_prompt
param.dialogReference:
Will be used when specifying workflow as 'Text SAM Feature extraction' above. Enter search terms that the SAM model will use as comma separated list.

Example: 'roof,house,building'
param.pythonReference:
comma separated String of search terms for SAM based model

Example: "roof,house,building"

param.name: batch_size
param.dialogReference: Enter DL batch size as integer. Value will depend on capabilities of hardware used. Common batch sizes are 4,8,16
param.pythonReference: Provide DL batch size as integer. Value will depend on capabilities of hardware used. Common batch sizes are 4,8,16

param.name: threshold
param.dialogReference: Define minimum statistical confidence value for a result being regarded valid. Enter value between 0 (any result qualifies) and 1.0 (only 100% matches qualify). Common values start at about 0.65, very good models provide results higher than 0.9
param.pythonReference: Parse minimum statistical confidence value for a result being regarded valid. Enter float value between 0.0 (any result qualifies) and 1.0 (only 100% matches qualify). Common values start at about 0.65 (65%), very good models provide results higher than 0.9 (90%)

param.name: processor_type
param.dialogReference: Select Processor type to use. If available, GPU is preferred. Otherwise choose CPU
param.pythonReference: Provide Processor type to use as string. If available, "GPU" is preferred. Otherwise hand over "CPU"

param.name: gpu_id
param.dialogReference: If GPU is the processor type, specify the GPU-Id of the GPU to use on your system. Refer to GPU doc for more info
param.pythonReference: Parse GPU-Id to use as integer. Refer to GPU doc for more info

param.name: processing_extent
param.dialogReference: Use any of the existing methods (Current Extent, Feature Class, ...) to specify the processing extent to use.
param.pythonReference: Parse processing extent. Use 'DEFAULT' or arcgis extent-object as string. See documentation.

param.name: processing_mask
param.pythonReference: Specify processing Mask feature class/dataset as full qualified String.

param.name: min_area
param.dialogReference: Min area (in SRS units) to qualify as result during post-processing
param.pythonReference: Integer/Float value for Min area (in SRS units) to qualify as result during post-processing

param.name: max_area
param.dialogReference: Max area (in SRS units) to qualify as result during post-processing
param.pythonReference: Integer/Float value for Max area (in SRS units) to qualify as result during post-processing

param.name: regularize_generalize
param.displayname: Regularize or Generalize the output feature
param.expression: Regularize Right Angle | Regularize Circle | Generalize
param.pythonReference: Specify Post-processing workflow to use as string. Currently supported 'Regularize Right Angle', 'Generalize' or 'Regularize Circle'

tool.summary:
MultiResolutionDL.pyt

This Python toolbox contains the Multi Resolution Deep Learning Tool.

This tool is designed to allow users to apply deep learning models to raster data at multiple scales.

This can be particularly useful for tasks such as feature extraction, where the size of the features of interest can vary widely.

The tool accepts a variety of input parameters, including the input raster, cell sizes, deep learning workflow, model definition, and output geodatabase, among others.

It also provides options for regularizing or generalizing the output feature.

The toolbox is designed to work with ArcGIS Pro and uses arcpy, the ArcGIS Python module, for many of its operations
tool.usage: Detect objects of varying size in a single process

scriptExample.title: arcpy sample call
scriptExample.code: arcpy.Multi Resolution Deep Learning.MultiScaleDL( in_raster=r"C:\data\DL\DroneOrtho.tif", cell_sizes="0.1,0.2,0.5,1,2,5", use_avg_cell_size=None, specified_cell_size=0.25, dl_workflow="Text SAM Feature Extraction", in_model_definition=r"C:\data\DL\model\mySAM.dlpk", out_gdb=r"C:\output\Results.gdb", out_fc_name="Buildings", text_prompt="Roof,Building,House,Shed,Garage", batch_size=16, threshold=0.65, processor_type="GPU", gpu_id=0, processing_extent='DEFAULT', processing_mask=None, min_area=4, max_area=4500, regularize_generalize="Regularize Right Angle" )
